column1: age: the customer’s current age
column3: at the time the fiscal quarter ended.

column1: avg monthly gb download: indicates the customer’s average download volume in gigabytes
column2: calculated to the end of the quarter specified above.

column1: avg monthly long distance charges: indicates the customer’s average long distance charges
column2: calculated to the end of the quarter specified above.

column1: churn category: a high-level category for the customer’s reason for churning: attitude
column5: price. when they leave the company
column6: all customers are asked about their reasons for leaving. directly related to churn reason.

column1: churn label: yes = the customer left the company this quarter. no = the customer remained with the company. directly related to churn value.
churn reason: a customer’s specific reason for leaving the company. directly related to churn category.
churn score category: a calculation that assigns a churn score to one of the following categories: 0-10
churn score: a value from 0-100 that is calculated using the predictive tool ibm spss modeler. the model incorporates multiple factors known to cause churn. the higher the score
column2: the more likely the customer will churn.

column1: churn value: 1 = the customer left the company this quarter. 0 = the customer remained with the company. directly related to churn label.
city: the city of the customer’s primary residence.
cltv category: a calculation that assigns a cltv value to one of the following categories: 2000-2500
cltv: customer lifetime value. a predicted cltv is calculated using corporate formulas and existing data. the higher the value
column2: the more valuable the customer. high value customers should be monitored for churn.

column1: contract: indicates the customer’s current contract type: month-to-month
country: the country of the customer’s primary residence.
customer status: indicates the status of the customer at the end of the quarter: churned
dependents: indicates if the customer lives with any dependents: yes
device protection plan: indicates if the customer subscribes to an additional device protection plan for their internet equipment provided by the company: yes
gender: the customer’s gender: male
internet service: indicates if the customer subscribes to internet service with the company: no
married: indicates if the customer is married: yes
monthly charge: indicates the customer’s current total monthly charge for all their services from the company.
multiple lines: indicates if the customer subscribes to multiple telephone lines with the company: yes
number of dependents: indicates the number of dependents that live with the customer.
number of referrals: indicates the number of referrals to date that the customer has made.
offer: identifies the last marketing offer that the customer accepted
online backup: indicates if the customer subscribes to an additional online backup service provided by the company: yes
online security: indicates if the customer subscribes to an additional online security service provided by the company: yes
paperless billing: indicates if the customer has chosen paperless billing: yes
payment method: indicates how the customer pays their bill: bank withdrawal
phone service: indicates if the customer subscribes to home phone service with the company: yes
population: a current population estimate for the entire zip code area.
premium tech support: indicates if the customer subscribes to an additional technical support plan from the company with reduced wait times: yes
quarter: the fiscal quarter that the data has been derived from (e.g. q3).
referred a friend: indicates if the customer has ever referred a friend or family member to this company: yes
satisfaction score label: indicates the text version of the score (1-5) as a text string.
satisfaction score: a customer’s overall satisfaction rating of the company from 1 (very unsatisfied) to 5 (very satisfied).
senior citizen: indicates if the customer is 65 or older: yes
state: the state of the customer’s primary residence.
streaming movies: indicates if the customer uses their internet service to stream movies from a third party provider: yes
column2: no. the company does not charge an additional fee for this service.

column1: streaming music: indicates if the customer uses their internet service to stream music from a third party provider: yes
column2: no. the company does not charge an additional fee for this service.

column1: streaming tv: indicates if the customer uses their internet service to stream television programing from a third party provider: yes
column2: no. the company does not charge an additional fee for this service.

column1: tenure in months: indicates the total amount of months that the customer has been with the company by the end of the quarter specified above.
total charges: indicates the customer’s total charges
column2: calculated to the end of the quarter specified above.

column1: total extra data charges: indicates the customer’s total charges for extra data downloads above those specified in their plan
column2: by the end of the quarter specified above.

column1: total long distance charges: indicates the customer’s total charges for long distance above those specified in their plan
column2: by the end of the quarter specified above.

column1: total refunds: indicates the customer’s total refunds
column2: calculated to the end of the quarter specified above.

column1: unlimited data: indicates if the customer has paid an additional monthly fee to have unlimited data downloads/uploads: yes
zip code: the zip code of the customer’s primary residence.
